skillTree.localised_description: A general's horse can be their most trusted and daring companion. Just don't name him 'Daisy'.

skillTree.localised_description: Loyal, fierce, powerful and surprisingly fast â€“ a War Bear is a symbol of Kislev itself.

skillTree.localised_description: Naught can penetrate the swirling mists of ice and sleet that churn around those afforded Father Bear's protection.

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target

skillTree.localised_description: The Grand Orthodoxy shall see Kislev rise again, mighty and without peer, with Ruin defeated and destroyed utterly.

effects.description:
Construction cost: +300% for Hallowed Wood buildings
	(all provinces)

Construction cost: -20% for Orthodoxy buildings
	(all provinces)

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: If Kislev and its people are to endure then they must fight to the death, lest the foe take all for which they have strived.
What the peasants really want, whether they know so or not, is a strong man; a man with will of iron so strong that death itself runs in his wake.
Faith in oneself and one's cause are at least as important as martial skill, if not more so.

effects.description:
Devotion gained from successful Hero actions: +20%
	(factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: Those among the faithful who show talent and promise soon find themselves raised up within Grand Orthodoxy to inspire and lead others.

effects.description:
Hero recruit rank: +2 for Patriarchs
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: There's nothing quite like a pious Kislevite man scorned, especially one whose rage is stoked by the finest kvas.
The power to rouse the rabble to terrific violence in a heartbeat is not to be underestimated.
Frail as they may seem, there is no doubt the Gods guide the Patriarch's arm, and lend him their strength in defence of the Motherland.
There is nothing but utter belief. There is no reasoning with this one.
"Don't look into their eyes, there is only death there!"
Such is this one's conviction that others have no choice but to believe.
Speaking words of power or faith can alter perceptions on the battlefield.
Kostaltynâ€™s flat metal discs, inscribed with Ursunâ€™s runes and icons, inspire even greater deeds when awarded to the worthy.
This one will not go down easily - it will be necessary to break both the will and the body first.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
This one fights with a fervour to be both admired and despised.
The longer you believe, the more intense that faith becomes. When your belief is total, there is nothing that you cannot achieve.
"Death is like a winter chill; No door can keep it from us; And summer yet may bloom againThough ice be all upon us."

effects.description: Cooldown: -25% to "Dazh's Song of Winter Sunlight"

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Again, again, again! We'll practice this until your fingers bleed!"

skillTree.localised_description: The warriors of the north carry conflict in their blood, a legacy left by the Khan-Kings and Khan-Queens of old.

skillTree.localised_description: Descended of the proud horse-warriors of the Gospodar, all Kislevites are born to the saddle like their ancestors before them.

skillTree.localised_description: "Ursun is with us, brothers! None can stand against the beasts of the Bear-God!"

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

items.colour_text: The Burning Brazier holds a flame taken from the Temple of Ursun. The more wounded the wielder becomes, the hotter the fire burns, and more terrible is its flaming touch.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "If you love the Bear you will happily die rather than be taken!"
